intro: Philippinaea wenzelii, commonly known as the Wenzel's philippinaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
